result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Wayne Blackdeer Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Wayne Blackdeer Jr.

records.addlTxt: Court costs and fines
Restitution
REVOKED - SENTENCED TO CO. JAIL/HOC 3-30-22

02:03 PM  Judge John Anderson appears by video from Bayfield County. Defendant Robert Wayne Blackdeer in court, appearing in person in custody, with attorney Renee M Taber.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case (19CF18, 22CM04, 14CF175) and recites appearances.  Atty Taber indicates global resolution for all 3 cases.  Court verifies all parties agree with video appearances.  State recites agreement.  State indicates compliance with victim's rights.  Atty Taber agrees with agreement as recited.  DEF agrees.    DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights.  

2:13PM OFF THE RECORD Zoom connection disconnected unexpectedly.

2:18PM BACK ON THE RECORD, appearances remain unchanged.  Court finds DEF knowingly and voluntarily waived his rights.  Atty Taber stipulates to facts.  Atty Taber enters plea of Guilty on behalf of DEF to count 1 in 19CF18 and count 1 in 22CM04.  DEF agrees with pleas.  Court accepts pleas and finds DEF guilty of count 1 in 19CF18 and count 1 in 22CM04.  State makes a statement prior to sentencing, agrees with convictions listed in revocation packet, agrees with 275 days credit in 14CF175.  Court clarifies victim's rights compliance.  State indicates no victims present in courtroom.  Court notes for record that no one is in zoom or on telephone.  Atty Taber makes statement prior to sentencing, recites credit, requests Huber (in 22CM04) and ERP and CIP (in 19CF18).  DEF makes no comment.  Court to follow agreement.  Court instructs DEF to provide a DNA sample and to report to Dept of Corrections within 48 hours of today.  Court indicates Clerk to complete WEDS.  





COURT:

19CF18 = 3.5 years Prison, consisting of 1.5 years confinement + 2 years extended supervision.  IMPOSED & STAYED 3 years probation, consecutive to 22CM04 and 14CF175.  Report to Dept of Corrections within 48 hours.  Conditions:  6 months driver's license revocation.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  Fine/costs $518, which includes DNA surcharge.    DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Eligible for Earned Release program/substance abuse program and Challenge Incarceration Program.  

22CM04 = 6 months Sawyer County Jail, consecutive to 14CF175.  Eligible for Huber and statutory good time.  Costs:  $443, which includes DNA surcharge.    DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge.    Pay obligation within 60 days or apply for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

14CF175 =   1 year Sawyer County Jail, with credit for 275 days.    Any unpaid court obligations and restitution are to be converted to Clerk of Court collect and civil judgment will be entered.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Attorney Renee Taber (DE to repay $60/month starting 03/15/2022)
JOC is missing from the packet
from Public Defender's Office as to bill for witness to fly to Wisconsin

Defendant Robert Wayne Blackdeer in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached agreement, Jury trial is cancelled.    
Court questions DE regarding sobriety. Court adjourns for DE and Atty to speak privately 9:05 am.  Back on the record 9:07.  DE states he is not under the influence of any substances.  Atty McLaughlin states he met with the DE prior to hearing regarding his current state of mind.  DE and the State wish to proceed.
Court adjourns again 9:14 am.  Back on the record 9:18.
DE pleads No Contest.  Found Guilty.
DA makes statement.  Atty McLaughlin makes statement.
Sentence is withheld: DE placed on 3 years probation, conditions of probation 90 days county jail, with Huber, Pay costs $518 including DE must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   Pay restitution $8742.82, No Contact with Kyle Oshogay.  DE to report to jail by January 26 2018 by 3:00 pm.  No jail credit.
Victim legislation has been complied with.  Victim is present in the courtroom and makes brief statement.

Out of state witness was successfully subpoenaed from Arizona. Not needed since trial was cancelled, but Atty McLaughlin will forward invoice to clerk of court.
State's Response to Motion to Compel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Wayne Blackdeer in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman  and Atty Sheila Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:30 OFF osoj; Jury Instruction, trial outline provided by court to parties, 1 motion in Limine; number of prior convictions- parties reached stipulation (see handout), note taking allowed, questions from jurors NO, DEFense defers opening statement,  No Court officer, No security issues, Seat 20 4 strikes each.  
OTROSO-  parties have stipulation regarding amount of priors for witnesses, court reviewed preliminary instructions that are to be given to jury.  Witnesses to be sequestered, parties share new information just learned of.  Witnesses may allege threat of harm by Blackdeer, DEF argues, PL Responds, Court relevant not other acts evidence, DEF argument, DA response,  DEF counsel asks to have Sheila Yohnk allowed to be seated and be co counsel, allowed by court.
9:10 am OTR with Jury- Judge gives opening instructions - Jurors sworn, court questions jurors.  
9:25 am PL questions jurors.
9:45 am DEF counsel questions jurors. 
Byrd questioned out side of rest of Jurors, ON the Record; relationship was soured, questioned by Atty Hoffman; Son was uncomfortable and got other counsel, questioned by DA, may have a problem not showing favor or dis-favor.  Strike for Cause, DEF Motion for mistrial based on Jurors comments regarding question, DA no response re mistrial.  Court declares a mistrial based on request.    10:08 
10:11 Judge excuses jurors - Mistrial
10:15  decision to have new Judge assigned
